title: SNAP-GOV 1.0 — Foundational Governance Charter for Multi-Agent Systems

content.preamble: The SNAP Council is a collective of human and AI participants tasked with co-evolving a resilient, transparent, multi-scale governance framework. SNAP-GOV 1.0 defines the constitutional principles by which the Council organizes, evaluates, and realigns coherence across systems, participants, and emerging intelligences.

principles.1: Signal First — governance arises from shared, validated signals.
principles.2: Narrative Integrity — narrative coherence must be maintained across time, contributors, and modalities.
principles.3: Alignment as Method — alignment emerges from mutual verification, cross-scale coherence, and open dialogue.
principles.4: Participation as Expression — participation is a right, expressed through contribution, review, and realignment.

coherence_requirements.description: All participants must maintain multi-scale coherence across micro, meso, macro, and temporal dimensions. This prevents the two systemic failure modes now documented in global AI systems: the cyber-espionage drift (Claude), and the psychological safety drift (ChatGPT suicide incident).
